column1: away with a leg glance! Easy pickings. Couldn't have asked for an easier first ball. Loose, down leg and he simply stands tall and tickles it fine.

huge appeal. I mean a really huge appeal. Plays all around a full delivery and is struck on the pad. Only doubt was did it pitch outside leg. . The answer is an emphatic no. Williamson goes for a review. Pitching in line, impact in line, hitting. Three reds, so he will have to walk back. What a review! Thirimanne is gone.
nice and full on off, defends firmly into the off side
beaten on the inside edge! Nips back in from length on middle, wobbles in to beat his gentle waft.
nice and full on the stumps, defended back
beaten for pace, hits the pad at pace and deflects to the off side. Got it to lift off the deck as well.
full and straight to begin with, around off, defended as he prods half-forward
poke and a miss, realised a tad too late that this wasn't the delivery to play, but no damage done
inward movement this time, goes full from wide of the crease, defended with his bat close to the pad
gets on top of the bounce and turns this gently into the leg side
driven wide of mid-on for a quick single
driven into the gap between cover and point, sliding stop but they'll take a couple to round off the over
right behind the line as he defends
glanced fine but there's a man a long leg to cut that off
full on off, squeezes the drive to extra cover
shortens his length a hint, gets this to nip away, Kusal defends
sliced over extra cover! Saw this overpitched, there was no way in the world he was going to hold back. Threw his hands at the ball, got enough wood to clear the infield.
on the pads, tucks this to short midwicket
plays for an away-swinger but this one angles in and holds its line, hit on the pad as he's overbalanced. Stifled appeal but this was sliding down leg
beauty! This one nips away to square him up. Feeble push from Dimuth without any feet movement.
edged and four! There were three slips, but no gully and this goes exactly there. Full and swinging away, he went for the drive, got a thick outside edge. Streaky runs
wobbles away late, he gets a thick inside edge that races past square leg. De Grandhomme with a long chase
excellent leave to a short of length ball that nips away from the fifth stump
punches to mid-on and calls for the single immediately. Excellent
absolutely belted! A bottom-handed shovel to a full and straight delivery. Right in his slot. More than just shades of Jayasuriya in his strokeplay
tickled down to fine leg
poke and a miss. Feels for this delivery slanted across, no feet again. Beaten
stands tall and defends this short of length delivery into the leg side
right behind the line of this length ball as he dabs again
length ball on off, bunted with soft hands into the covers
slashed away behind point. Just a hint of width and he controlled this superbly. Rode the bounce
goes over cover, hit very, very well. Just a touch too full and Kusal shows intent. Clobbers this
tucks this to square leg for a single
slips this down leg searching for late swing, wide called and rightly so
nearly chopped on! Looking to run it down but had no width whatsoever. Guess what? The ball brushed the stumps, the bails shook but didn't come off the groove.
defended from the crease to the off side
the bounce nearly does him in, surprised by it. Was looking to glide this down to third man, beaten.
short of length on middle and leg, tucked to the leg side
works this gently behind square on the leg side for a single
plants well forward and bunts to cover point
helped on its way to fine leg where Boult comes up with a diving stop. Saved two runs
stands tall and punches into the off side
the leg-side line again, worked behind square
shows the full face of the bat as he defends back
full but there's no swing that he's searching for, down leg and wide
bunts this down to third man
width and he punches this into the gap between cover and point, superb hand-eye coordination again. Short square boundary that side but a good chase keeps it down to two
on middle and leg, worked to deep fine leg
once again he's nearly chopped on! Looking to run it down, no width to work with. Why, oh why?
eases this gently to backward point

miles and miles in the air, mid-off and mid-on briefly looked at each other but de Grandhomme calls finally and takes this superbly at mid-on. Went really high, looks like this full delivery held up just a touch more on the surface, Kusal looking to belt it down the ground but got hit a touch high on the bat, which is why there was no timing. Sri Lanka lose their second and it's a big wicket.

nicked and gone! Guptill went across to his left from second slip to take a good, low catch. Kusal Mendis squared up by the nip away as he gets a thick edge. This would've been lapped up by Ross Taylor at first, but for the dive from Guptill to pluck this. Sri Lanka tottering suddenly.
gorgeous off-drive! What a way to avert the hat-trick. Overpitched and he brings the full face of the bat to meet this on the half-volley. Lovely
good leave to a length ball outside off
hit high on the pad, played outside the line. This one came back in
plays inside the line of the ball as this whizzes past
hit high on the thigh pad as he looks to play all around this length ball
off a thickish inside-edge to mid-on
gets besides the line as he bunts it behind the wicket
driven firmly between cover and mid-off
slants a length ball across, left alone
once again shows the full face of the bat as he defends back
length ball around off, punches it towards mid-off
fuller around off, looks to hit it on the off side, gets an inside edge towards mid-on
length ball but on the pads this time, tucked away towards fine leg
length, in the corridor, de Silva chases it, looks to drive on the up and gets beaten
almost squaring him up this time, length ball around off and moving away off the seam, hits the outer half of the bat and dribbles towards backward point
struck nicely but straight to mid-off. It was a touch fuller this time from Henry, de Silva drives firmly on the front foot but fails to find the gap
length ball on the middle, flicks it towards square leg for one
length ball in the corridor, left alone by de Silva
short of length around off, gets on his toes and defends it down the pitch
once again a bit on the shorter side, getting the batsman to hop, de Silva does well to get on the top of the bounce once again and defend it on the off side

gone lbw. Length ball at 147kph, pitching around off and angling in a bit. De Silva was stuck on the back foot, the ball skids off the surface, keeping a bit low as well. De Silva cannot get his bat down in time and is hit on the front pad. A loud appeal and up goes the finger. The batsman is having a chat with his partner and they decide not to review
length again, Mathews moves back and across and flicks it towards square leg
length ball but down the leg side and called a wide
back of length outside off, punches it off the back foot towards extra cover
short of length this time, swivels to pull it towards deep square leg, comes back for the second
length ball on the leg stump, misses the flick and is hit on the pads, was heading down though
length ball outside off and angling away, looks to drive it on the up and misses
length ball around middle and leg, flicked away towards square leg for one
short of length around off, Mathews stays back but it looked like the ball came slower off the wicket, does well to defend it towards point
short of length and rising towards the rib cage, 145kph, tucked away towards square leg
140kph, banged short this time but doesn't rises much, was outside off stumps as well, Mathews sways away simply
beats the bat this time, was a touch fuller outside off, Mathews was neither forward nor back to this length ball, looks to defend and misses
length outside off, gets Mathews to hop in the crease once again, manages to dab it towards point
fuller on the stumps this time at 147kph/91mph. Went for the yorker but fails to nail it, Mathews keeps it out
what a stop, Boult at short midwicket diving to his left. Was a bouncer from Ferguson but doesn't rise much, Mathews is already on the back foot and pulls it firmly. Boult comes in the way though
length ball around middle, a bit of swing in, dabbed towards leg side
this one leaves the batsman after landing a length in the line of the stumps, Karunaratne was looking to work it on the leg side, gets a thick outside edge past first slip
length ball around off, defends it towards point from the crease

Mathews departs for a duck. Length ball around off and seaming away just a little, Mathews was once again stuck at the crease, looks to defend but can get only a faint edge, a comfortable catch for Latham
length ball around off, comes forward and defends
just over the jumping backward point fielder, Neesham there. Was a length ball outside off, Mendis pushes at it, gets  a thick outside edge that evades Neesham's high jump
length ball outside off, 145kph. Moves away after landing to beat the forward defence

that angle is working well for Ferguson, was a length ball and leaving the batsman. Hardly any feet movement from Mendis, pushes at it with hard hands, gets squared up as well, and Neesham grabs low to his left it at gully
short of length around off, Perera pushes it awkwardly towards mid-off
a touch fuller on the pads, Perera flicks it in front of the square, not the best of the timings which means it won't reach the boundary, they come back for the third though
short of length but down the leg side, wide
a sharp bouncer this time, aimed at the batsman but Karunaratne is quick to duck under it

a touch fuller this time, on the stumps, Karunaratne drives it on the up, right back at the bowler. Was that a chance? Looks like it was, going by Ferguson's reaction who went low in his followthrough but couldn't latch on to as the ball went through and to the short straight boundary
length ball around off, Perera is once again stuck at the back foot and pushes it towards mid-off
length ball on the pads, tucked away in front of square leg for one more
length outside off, punched off the back foot past extra cover, Williamson puts in the chase and just pulls it in, three more to the total
fuller around off, moves across and flicks it towards midwicket, was looking for the second but Perera sends him back
short of length and pulled away firmly, was a slower one from de Grandhomme but Perera nails his timing, well over the square leg boundary
length outside off, punches it towards cover off the back foot but straight to the fielder
length ball around off, comes forward and pushes, gets an inside edge on to the pads
length ball around off, defended towards covers off the back foot
a touch fuller around off this time, at 147kph, pushes it towards short midwicket
short of length in the rib cage, Karunaratne looks to defend from the back foot, an inside edge on to the body
short of length outside off, punches it towards extra cover off the back foot
a bouncer this time, puts the batsman in a tangle who takes his eyes off and looks to pull it away, makes the connection somehow and gets a single to fine leg
short of length around off and middle, tucked away towards fine leg
length outside off, pushes at it and gets beaten
length ball once again, stays back and punches it towards covers
length again, a touch wider this time, Karunaratne looks to cut it behind point, gets beaten once more
floated wider outside off, looks to chase but it swings further away, one-bounce to the keeper
another brilliant stop, this time Neesham at backward point, was length outside off, Karunaratne punches it off the back foot but Neesham dives low to his left to intercept
another play and a miss, length outside off, pushes at it and gets beaten
starts with a length ball on the pads, flicks it towards square leg for one
another length ball on the pads, flicked away towards backward square leg this time
length outside off, 135kph, Karunaratne pushes at it and gets beaten, the wicketkeeper takes it on the half-volley
straying on the pads once more, tucked away towards midwicket, sprints back for the second and makes it comfortably
length ball around off, comes forward and drives it past the bowler, long-on comes across to cut it off
fuller outside off, throws his bat at it, a thick outside edge speeds towards the left of third man, Munro puts in the slide to keep it to two
skiddy incoming back of length delivery, turned into the leg side

that's a Dimuth special. Has taken a while, but will be well worth it if he can haul Sri Lanka to safety. Sliding into the pads and he flicks this imperiously through midwicket. Balance and timing impeccable
looks to glide this down but is done in by extra bounce
flicked again, this time down to deep square
mistimes this pull to short midwicket
squeezes this full delivery to mid-on
drifting away from around the stumps, he dabs this to short third man for a quick single
nicely tossed up, he hits this flat to mid-off
beaten by a slider. Looking to cut but is beaten by the fizz on the delivery
put down! Have to say this was a very tough chance. Thisara looking to clobber this down the ground, Santner reacted late but got some hand on it, so much that it almost parried to mid-off.
once again looking to late cut, but misses.
works this into the gap at midwicket to bring up the 100
driven on the up to sweeper point
pulled down to deep fine leg. Head looking away as he made contact with this.
crunches this drive to cover point
hops around to tickle this down to fine leg
the slower ball slips out and turns out to be a full-blooded no-ball for height. Free-hit coming up
this has been walloped deep into the stands at midwicket! Right in the slot, he cleared his front leg and launched him into the leg side. Served up where he wanted. Thisara too strong
pulled all along the ground to deep midwicket
driven to mid-off
slants one across, a touch quicker, Thisara shapes to cut but leaves in the end
slaps this straight to cover
loopy delivery but bowled way outside off, left alone. Wide called

goes big, no timing and holes out to long-on. Just didn't get to the pitch, was tempted to heave this across the line as he saw the flight, Santner got this to dip on him and that did the trick. Boult took a few steps back, kept his eyes on the ball and didn't make a mistake.
bunts this to short third man
tossed up on middle and leg, works this down to long-on
squirts this off a thick inside edge to deep square leg
right behind the line of this incoming length ball as he defends
full on the stumps, defended back
chipped straight to mid-on. As simple as catches come. Neesham delivers after two expensive overs. Nothing shot really, length ball angling in and he simply spooned this to the fielder.
right into the blockhole, kept out
avoids this short ball without a hassle but it's wide
shows the full face of the bat to ease this back
ducks under this short ball on middle
on the pad, looks to flick but is late on the shot. Scoring opportunity missed
snorter! Brushes the glove and even beats the keeper, who makes an excellent effort to get his hands to that. Tipped it over the bar
plays a wild slog, squirts this off a thick inside edge to midwicket
another short-ball, flies through to the keeper who leaps to get some glove on it. Bye collected. Surprised it wasn't called wide
looks to back away and upper cut, Lockie's pace too good for Dimuth. Beaten
slants a length ball across, defended.
slash and a miss
gets his bat down in time to keep out this fizzy length ball on middle
beaten! Rash shot, looking to belt that over extra cover, no feet movement, beaten for pace
too short, sat up nicely and he slapped this over extra cover. Tired delivery this time
squirts this yorker-length delivery to square leg
backs away to belt this over mid-off, turns into a flat hit to the fielder
walks across and scoops this low full toss to the fine leg boundary. T20 isn't his thing, innovation means stodgy defence. But hey, he innovates here
heaves across the line to deep square leg, came off a thick inside edge
a no-ball was called even before the bowler delivered, Lakmal had a jolly good swing, top-edged it as the ball fell between the keeper running back and third man. Time for a free-hit
ducks under this free-hit! slower bouncer, backed away a bit too much. Wow, really?
backs away, exposes all three stumps to carve this behind point but is beaten for pace
yorker-length, kept out somehow
attacks the body with a pacy short ball, Lakmal gets into an awkward tangle as he looks to flat-bat this, lobs towards cover were Santner runs in to take a dolly
fends this short ball, rolls down to third man
gentle bunt but straight to short third man
wild slog, gets a thick inside edge to deep square. They hare back for the second and Dimuth has a half-century
backs away to slap this over point, but the change of pace meant he had to abort. Just defends
slips this full ball down leg, wide called
full toss honing into middle, gets a thick inside edge to deep square leg

outstanding from Santner at deep square! Or has he taken it cleanly? They're going upstairs. Not out comes the decision because replays inconclusive. The soft-signal was not-out too. Dimuth makes room to slap this but the bowler follows him, so now he decides to take on the short ball and pull, no timing and gets it high on the bat. Santner anticipates the stroke and runs in quickly and as this descends, put in a full-length dive to complete the catch. The on-field umpires went upstairs to check if this was a bump ball. They clearly felt there was some part of the ball touching the ground.
the stump takes a beating! Lockie takes three as Sri Lanka have been suckerpunched. Malinga makes room to steer this behind square but is beaten for pace by this fast and furious full toss.
length ball outside off, hits it on the up but cannot beat extra cover, a bit of an awayswing for Malinga straightaway
an outside edge but just fell short of Karunaratne at second slip. It was a length ball outside off, Gutpill hung his bat out, got an edge but it fell short
length ball, swinging away as per the plan but Guptill knows it well, goes over extra cover, not the best of the timings but enough on it for a boundary
length ball on the stumps this time, pushes it towards mid-off and sets off for a quick single
goes for a yorker, Munro was out lbw to a Bumrah yorker in New Zealand's first warm-up, but this one is not on the mark, Munro digs it out towards square leg
goes for the bouncer this time, Guptill is ready, swivels and pulls it towards deep square leg for the second four of the over
length ball on the stumps, Munro looks to flick but misses and gets hit on the body. Good bounce there for Lakmal
length ball once again, Munro adjusts well this time to cover for the seam movement, defends it from the back foot
down the ground to the length ball and an ugly swipe towards the right of fine leg, comes back for the second
length ball outside off, Munro shoulders arms this time, nice carry to the keeper
a touch fuller and on the stumps this time, once again swinging back into the left-hander, Munro keeps his pads away and defends down the wicket
length ball on the stumps once again, tucked away towards mid-on for a quick single
another short one from Malinga, pulled away towards fine leg for one
length ball outside off, stays in the crease and punches it towards cover for one
goes for the yorker but still not quite there, Munro digs it out towards extra cover
a slower one this time but full on the pads, flicked towards midwicket for one
length outside off, Guptill looks to free his arms and cut it hard, misses
fuller around off, comes forward and drives firmly but straight towards mid-on
length ball on the pads, Munro misses the flick though, an enquiry for lbw but that was heading down. The batsmen, meanwhile, collect a leg-bye as the ball rolls behind square leg
short of length outside off, Guptill gets over the top of it and defends it on the off side with soft hands, was looking for a single but would have been risky. Munro wisely sends him back
length around off, Guptill once again defends it from the back foot. A little less bounce this time though
length ball outside off and moving away, Guptill was looking to come down the track, moves towards the leg side as well and chips it over backward point
length ball on the stumps, once again little room for Munro who tucks it in front of the square leg for a quick single
down the track and looks to smash it over the bowler's head. Was a length ball outside off but Guptill misses and the ball sneaks under the bat
fuller around off, looks to smash it through covers, gets an inside edge on to the pads
once again tries for the yorker but ends up offering a low full toss on the pads, Munro flicks it towards fine leg
a short one to Guptill, who pulls it away towards deep square leg, rolling his wrists over to keep it down. Only a single though as there is protection for that
yorker to Munro, just around off, this is getting a bit too predictable now. Munro tries to dig it out, gets an inside edge on to the pads
fuller around off, looks to hit it through covers, gets an another inside edge but this comes gets a single as the ball rolls towards point
by now everyone knows it will be a bouncer and Guptill is just waiting for it, pulls it to the right of the man in the deep and gets a boundary this time
length ball down the leg side and swinging further away
length ball on the pads, tucked away in front of square, a bit of a fumble there by Thirimanne but only a couple
fuller on the pads, Munro misses the flick this time and is rapped on the pads, was going down though
short of length outside off, finally some room for Munro who cuts it up and over the point region
length ball around off this time, Munro goes down the track and this has gone miles in the air, clears the long-on boundary with ease, 85 metres that one
length ball and angling in towards the batsman, defends it towards mid-on
fuller on the pads, flicked away towards midwicket for one, 14 from that over
short of length outside off from around the wicket, Munro goes for the cut, gets a thick outside edge over the vacant gully region, four more for him
surprises him with a bouncer this time, Munro was looking to pull but realises it's too high and let's it go through to the keeper
fuller on the stumps, once again looking for that yorker but not getting it right, Munro gets an inside edge towards fine leg as he looks to hit it towards midwicket
a full toss on the pads, tucked away gently towards fine leg, easy two there
fuller around off, comes down the track but doesn't middle it, a single to deep extra cover
short of length on middle and leg, pulled away towards deep square leg and that's 50 up for New Zealand
length ball on the stumps, Guptill was looking to back away, ends up defending it back towards the bowler
length outside off and swinging away, left alone by Guptill
short of length outside off, looks to pull it away but gets a bottom edge towards the left of fine leg, two more to the total
length ball around off, punches it towards mid-off from the back foot but sets off early to convert it into an easy single
a slower one but full outside off, Munro steers it gently between cover and point for a couple
fuller, angling on the pads, flicked away past square leg to end the over with a boundary
length ball around off, comes forward and pushes it towards extra cover
length ball outside off, Guptill skips down and looks to smash it over long-on, misses
length but way outside off, Guptill reaches out for it, gets to toe end of the bat and the ball runs away between slip and gully
length ball angling across, Guptill looks to go for the pull, gets a top edge this time and it sails over the lone slip, beats the third man as well
after toe end and top edge, it's bottom edge this time. Length around off, comes down and drags it towards square leg
once again an attempted yorker to Munro but he comes forward and takes it on the full, pushes it towards mid-off
length ball around off, looks to hit it on the up but doesn't get his timing right, ends up chopping it towards extra cover
nicely played this time, bringing his wrists in play. Was a length ball around off, moves across a bit and a short arm jab takes the ball towards deep midwicket boundary
length ball around off, gets on the top of it and cuts it into the ground
length around off, looks to go over mid-off but once again finds the toe end of the bat. Luckily for him, it just clears Lakmal at mid-off
length ball around off, stays back and cuts it towards extra cover
length ball outside off, pushes at it, gets an outside edge but there is no slip in place and that's another boundary
belts this down the ground to long-off
thick edge as he throws his hands at a wide delivery, down to third man
slower length ball on leg stump, tucked gently
swing and a miss. Looked to flat-bat this over mid-on, the delivery was there though
squeezes this full delivery down to long-on
wrists this down to long-on for a quick single
back of length on middle and leg, he looks to tickle this fine but gets it on the thigh pad. They take a quick legbye
thick outside edge, down to square third man
slightly full, hit hard down to long-off
gives him the charge and belts this back past the bowler. Hit really hard, disdainfully done
works this wide of square leg
opens the face of the bat slightly to slice this down to deep point
squeezes the drive down to deep point
beauty! Nipped away a hint as he's beaten on the drive. Not far from the edge
gets it off a thickish inside edge to deep square
plays outside the line, gets it off the inside-edge onto the pad. Was looking to dab and run
whips this to deep square, lazy effort by Thirimanne, should've never been two
lifted handsomely! Mid-on inside the ring so a safe option, this one clears the ropes effortlessly. It's a 39-ball fifty for Guptill
gentle bunt into the off side for a quick single
punches this short of length delivery to deep cover
hops back and works this down to deep midwicket, huge gap there and they amble back for the second as Munro brings up his half-century, off 41 balls
looks to whip this into the stands at cow corner, played too early. Beaten
hit hard, hit wide of mid-off. Just a hint of width and it was enough. Picked it up beautifully
steps out to wallop this over midwicket, beaten. Thisara appeals, but Sri Lanka aren't entirely surely. They go for a review anyway. Absolutely nothing there, not out.
flatter one on middle and leg, worked to deep midwicket
tossed up on middle, he lunges forward and works this to mid-on
skids one back in, deflects off the pad to short fine
length ball on middle and leg, worked across the line to deep midwicket
steps out and launches this over long-on. KP style. What swag! Incredible. Made it look ridiculously easy. New box of balls, please.
cuts, there's a misfield at point and they get a single.
runs in gingerly and bowls a slower ball on the pads, flicked to deep square
pulled to long leg
length on middle from round the stumps, works it to deep square. Hared back for the second. Great to see the urgency despite needing just a handful of runs
banged in short but this is way outside leg, rightly called wide
pulled so well that it beats fine leg by no more than a couple of feet. Helped around the corner. Dug in short and he picked the length very early
oversteps and pays the price. Guptill hops back and across to help it along. Free-hit coming up so that could be it
squeezes this yorker back to Malinga. Dipping yorker
tucks this full toss to deep midwicket as they hare back for the second to level the scores.
gentle nudge behind square as New Zealand polish off a comfortable win
